snippet: A review of the Port Authority’s operations suggests that it had been turned into a de facto political operation for Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey long before the bridge scandal.
abstract: Review of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey’s operations since New Jersey Gov Chris Christie took office suggests that it had been turned into de facto political operation for him long before the George Washington Bridge scandal; former Port Authority colleagues say sanctioned maneuvers that included rewarding friends and punishing adversaries emboldened Christie team to close down bridge lanes.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

lead_paragraph: A review of the Port Authority’s operations suggests that it had been turned into a de facto political operation for Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey long before the bridge scandal.

headline.main: Even Before Fort Lee Lane Closings, Port Authority Was a Christie Tool
headline.print_headline: Before Fort Lee, Port Agency Was a Christie Tool
